description: From Middle English hainous, from Old French haïneus (compare French haineux) from haïr (“to hate”), hadir (“to hate”) (compare Old French enhadir (“to become filled with hate”)), from Frankish *hattjan (“to hate”)

adjectives.description: heinous (comparative more heinous, superlative most heinous)

examples: I hope they catch the person responsible for that heinous crime.
The perpetrators of this heinous act must be brought to justice.
